channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gold Futures Rise as U.S. Economic Data Points to Cooling Economy
item.description: Gold futures rose as the market digested the latest U.S. economic data and its consequences for interest-rate cuts.

item.title: U.S. Stocks Mixed as Investors Raise Bets on December Rate Cut

item.title: How Parents Can Help Their Boomerang Child---Without Derailing Their Own Retirement
item.description: Set boundaries and encourage responsibility for your kids, and consider making catch-up contributions in your 401(k)s and IRAs.

item.title: Why Trump’s tariff threats will hit stocks sooner than you think
item.description: Trump’s trade team could be even more hawkish this time around.

item.title: Korean stocks fall in volatile trade as lawmakers override president’s martial-law declaration
item.description: U.S.- and U.K.-listed shares of South Korean stocks slumped on Tuesday after its president made a sudden declaration of martial law.

item.title: 4 life and investing lessons from NYSE icon Art Cashin, dead at 83

item.title: Charities see an uptick in giving. This Giving Tuesday, they can thank retirees for that.
item.description: Older Americans can still do a better job of donating in a tax-advantageous way, experts said.
